metadata.title: CVE-2024-34055 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Cyrus IMAP before 3.8.3 and 3.10.x before 3.10.0-rc1 allows authenticatedattackers to cause unbounded memory allocation by sending many LITERALs ina single command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-34055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-caldav - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-clients - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-common - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-imapd - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-murder - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-nntpd - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-pop3d - 3.8.3-1
cyrus-replication - 3.8.3-1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 3.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.3-1').
